description: Sequential Enhancement Framework for Comedic Headline Reinterpretation

Sign up now and get 'Cell'ular service that's really 'behind bars'. Plus, enjoy the 'jailbreak' feature - limited to once per customer!"

headlines.Human: Big Tax Deductions for College Expenses. Paying for college is costly.  But there are some tax benefits that can help parents who are footing the bill, or students who are independent.

headlines.Human: Dear G8: Be Bold and Inclusive in Tackling Hunger. As an amateur climber for 20 years, I learned that to scale daunting cliffs and ice, two core attributes are required -- courage and teamwork. You probably feel like you have been climbing your own mountain after two days of G8 talks at Camp David
headlines.Output: Dear G8, remember, tackling global issues is like my 20 years of amateur climbing - it requires courage, a climbing buddy, and maybe a mountain of snack bars to plateau those hunger issues!

headlines.Human: If The Holidays Are Driving You Mad, Baby Bjork Reading The Nativity Story Will Help. Once a renegade visionary, always a renegade visionary.
headlines.Output: When the holiday madness gets too much, just imagine Bjork reinterpreting the nativity story with a band of reggae lobsters, a raving pigeon, a choir of kazoo-playing dolphins, and a breakdancing baby Jesus. All narrated in a neon tutu, of course. That's the kind of holiday cheer you can't find just anywhere.

headlines.Human: How the Giants Collapsed. With the season only half over, the Giants still could end up with a playoff spot, but if they continue their losing ways for another week or two, even that will be unlikely.
headlines.Output: "Giants Misunderstand Playoff Spot as 'Play-Off' Spot. Halfway into the season, they seem to be playing off the field more than on it, turning the concept of 'winning' into a punchline!"

headlines.Human: The Most Haunting Version of Adele's 'Hello' So Far. Mozart cello mash-up is off the musical scale.

headlines.Human: Don't Call Them Dropouts. No one should sit in judgment of the challenging choices many Americans have to make and the circumstances that lead them to leave school.
headlines.Output: "Don't call them 'dropouts', they're the adventurous Americans who chose to swap the quadratic formula for life's cliffhangers. Who needs school when life's a suspense thriller?"
